sentences.sentence: He ordered this servant to bring him the poor shepherd( 牧羊人 )’s clothing he had worn when he first came to the palace.
There were a rough( 粗糙的 ) shirt made from leather( 皮革 ), and a large piece of sheep skin which he put around his neck and which looked like a robe( 礼袍 ).
These clothes were much less beautiful than the ones he was wearing, but still he got undressed and put them on.
Then he picked up( 拿起 ) the large shepherd( 牧羊人 )’s staff( 拐杖 ), which he had once used when guiding his sheep.
And then the young servant opened his big blue eyes in wonder, and said with a smile, “My King, I see your robe( 礼袍 ) and your scepter( 权杖 ), but where is your crown( 王冠 )?”
The young King went into the garden, and picked a small branch( 树枝 ) covered with( 布满 ) many thorns( 刺 ).
He bent( 把...弄弯 ) it, and made it into a little circle, and set it on his own head.
“This will be my crown( 王冠 ),” he answered.
And then dressed in this way, he went into the Great Hall, where the officials( 官员 ) were waiting for him.
The King’s officials( 官员 ) laughed, and some of them said to him, “My Lord, the people wait for their king, and you give them a beggar( 乞丐 ).”
Others were angry and said, “He brings shame upon our kingdom, and does not deserve( 值得 ) to be our king.”
The young King did not say a word, but instead passed them by.
He climbed onto his horse, went through the palace gates, and rode toward the cathedral( 大教堂 ), where the coronation( 加冕 ) ceremony( 典礼 ) would take place.
The people saw the young King, and said, “Look, it is the King’s fool( 弄臣 ) who is riding by!”
And they all laughed at him.
He stopped his horse and said, “No, I am the King.”
And he told them about his three dreams.
And then a man came forward from the crowd( 人群 ) of people, and said, “Sir, do you not know that out of the pleasure of the rich comes the life of the poor?
You are the richest man in the land.
If you do not live like a king, then we will not be able to live at all.
It is a hard life to work for a cruel( 残忍的 ) master( 雇主 ), but it is even worse to have no master( 雇主 ) at all to work for.
Will you say to the buyer, ‘You will buy for this much,’ and to the seller, ‘You will sell at this price?’
I do not think you will.
Therefore, go back to your palace, put on your robe( 礼袍 ) and crown( 王冠 ), and pick up( 拿起 ) your scepter( 权杖 ).
What do you know about us, and about what we suffer( 承受（痛苦） )?”
The young King’s eyes filled with( 充满 ) tears( 眼泪 ).
He rode on through the crowds( 人群 ), and could hear the people whispering( 窃窃私语 ) around him.
The young servant grew afraid and left him.
When he reached the great entrance to the cathedral( 大教堂 ), the soldiers( 士兵 ) stopped the young King’s horse and said,
“What are you doing here? This door is for the King, and no one else may enter.”
The young King’s face turned red with anger, and he said to them, “I am the King,”
and then he ordered them to let him through, and went inside.
